dao

Class DocumentTermMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • dao.DocumentTermMatrix

  • public class DocumentTermMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    The inverse of an inverted index, this class stores a matrix with one row for each documentID and one column for each termID. One may think of a DocumentTermMatrix as documentTerm - Vectors in the Vectorspace created by the terms. To save memory, termIDs are used instead of Strings. Thus, an (outside) Vocabulary needs to maintain the correct termID-term mapping.

      • DocumentTermMatrix

        public DocumentTermMatrix()

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the contents of the matrix.

      • addDoc

        public DocumentTermList addDoc(int newDoc)
        Creates a new row in the matrix for the given document and returns a DocumentTermList associated with this entry. If the document already had a row associated with it, this method does not modify the matrix and simply returns the previously associated DocumentTermList.
        Parameters:
        newDoc -
        Returns:

      • sortTermListingsByID

        public void sortTermListingsByID()
        Sorts all rows in the matrix by termID.

      • getMatrix

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,DocumentTermList> getMatrix()
        Returns the matrix. Usually, you want to call sortTermListingsByID() prior to calling this method.

      • getNumberOfDocs

        public int getNumberOfDocs()
        Returns the number of rows in the matrix.
        Returns:

      • calculateIdfs

        public void calculateIdfs(Vocabulary vocabulary)
        Calculates the IDF value for all entries in the matrix. This assumes that the current entry value hold the termFrequency instead (values will be overwritten). The provided vocabulary is needed to get the documentFrequency of terms.
        Parameters:
        vocabulary -

      • applyTfThresholds

        public int applyTfThresholds(int lowTfThreshold,
                    int highTfThreshold)
        Can only be called *before* calling calculateIdfs(Vocabulary). This will delete entries in the matrix if the termFrequency of the entry is outside the thresholds provided.
        Parameters:
        lowTfThreshold -
        highTfThreshold -
        Returns:
        The total number of terms removed from this matrix.
